alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET... SOUTHEASTERN WICOMICO AND WORCESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT... At 851 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newark around 920 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ocean City Municipality, Salisbury-Wicomico, Ironshire, Willards, Longridge, Cedartown, Pittsville, Powellville, Mount Wesley, and Whaleyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico
